Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup-skyphos; interior reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: glazed black at rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of bearded male figure to left (head with fillet, himation and beard in added red remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 367, no. B492, pl. CLXXXVI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1270) (phase 3)
